intro: Eriogonum mortonianum, commonly known as the Mortons Mountain buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its dense, gray-green foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features. Eriogonum mortonianum is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils.
